DataElement.preferredName: Pathology Report Confirmed Diagnosis Uploaded To Database Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/unknown response to a question that asks if the pathology reports confirming diagnosis was uploaded into the database.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pathology Report Confirmation Diagnosis Upload To Database Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread._Having been established or verified._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._To transfer a file or program to a central computer from a smaller computer or a computer at a remote location._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._An information set with a regular structure.  Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerized data, and is used almost exclusively in computing._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pathology report provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. Report defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread. Essential information to be included in a pathology report: the date and name of the report, slide number, the source of the specimen, the primary tumor size, he histologic diagnosis including the grade or degree of differentiation, the extent of disease within and beyond the primary site.

Concepts.definition: A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread.

Property.preferredName: Confirmation Diagnosis Upload To Database Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:To transfer a file or program to a central computer from a smaller computer or a computer at a remote location.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:An information set with a regular structure.  Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerized data, and is used almost exclusively in computing.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
To transfer a file or program to a central computer from a smaller computer or a computer at a remote location.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
An information set with a regular structure.  Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerized data, and is used almost exclusively in computing.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Pathology reports confirming
ReferenceDocuments.description: Pathology reports confirming diagnoses must be uploaded into the database via Medidata Rave greater than or equal to 30 days post Registration/Randomization

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is an institutional pathology report confirming favorable histology Wilms tumor available for upload prior to initiation of protocol therapy, where pathology was obtained either at relapse (preferred) or at the time of original diagnosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the pathology report and the NGS to evaluate for ARID1A mutation report been uploaded to Medidata Rave?
